availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Clark (Todd Co, Ky, merchant and prov govt)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, merchant and provisional government member. Virginia native. Married to Mary Ann Kennedy Clark in Todd County, Kentucky, on October 30, 1849. Father of W.R. Clark. Merchant in Todd County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provision government held at Russellville in November 1861. Merchant in Todd County in February 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 724.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film #000367186, p. 57.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Todd County, KY, February 1864, p. 26, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
KYR-0004-033-0001.
Find A Grave, "James T. Clark (July 2, 1825-June 19, 1869)," Memorial #48612609, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48612609 (accessed October 23, 2019).
